project3.three
Class Rule

java.lang.Object
  project3.three.Node
      project3.three.Rule

public class Rule
extends Node

A Rule in the datalog program.

Syntax: Rule -→ Head ":-" PredicateList "." 

 Domain Definition:
     head : Head
     tail : PredicateList

 Instance Invariant:
     head ≠ null AND
     tail ≠ null
Last Modified: 21 Feb 2006

Version:
1.0
Author:
Scott N. Woodfield

Constructor Detail

Rule

public Rule(Lex lex)
     throws ParserException
Constructs a Rule from the tokens in the lexical analyzer.

Precondition: lex ≠ null AND
  ∃i (∃j (ValidHead(lex[0..i]) AND lex[i+1].getTokenType() == TokenType.COLON_DASH AND ValidPredicateList(lex[i+2..j]) AND lex[j+1].getTokenType() == TokenType.PERIOD))
Postcondition: ∃i (∃j (head = new Head(lex[0..i]) AND tail = new PredicateList(lex[i+2..j]) AND lex[j+1].getTokenType() == TokenType.PERIOD))

Parameters:
lex - the lexical analyzer we will create a Rule from.
Throws:
ParserException
See Also:
Source Code
Method Detail

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Converts the Rule to a lexical representation.

Precondition: none
Postcondition: result = head.toString() + ":-" + tail.toString() + "."

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
the string representation of a Rule
See Also:
Source Code

prove

public boolean prove(Predicate predicate)
              throws ParserException
Determines wheter this rule can show that the predicate is true.

Precondition: predicate ≠ null
Postcondition: result = for every variable in the tail that exists in head we substitutie the corresponding constant in the predicate and we can find a set of constants from the domain that make the tail true, then return true, else return false.

Parameters:
predicate - the predicate (with all constants) we are going to test.
Returns:
true iff after substituting all of the constants of the predicate into the corresponding variables of the head of the rule, can we find a substitution for the remaining free variables that make it true.
Throws:
ParserException
See Also:
